HJaPUMb_9.description: A solid circle will be drawn in the centre of the display. Every two seconds the display will be inverted.
HJaPUMb_9.label: DEV

@/04-example-invert-display.description: A filled circle will be drawn in the centre of the display. Every two seconds the display colour will be inverted.

@/06-example-chequerboard.description: A chequerboard will be drawn on the display.

SklJmiYLE.description: TRUE to enable lower brightness mode, FALSE for full brightness.
SklJmiYLE.label: DIM

@/dim-display.description: Dim display. This has an immediate effect on the display, no need to use the send-buffer-to-display node -- buffer contents are not changed.

B13M_058N.description: TRUE to fill circle with colour, FALSE to draw outline only.
B13M_058N.label: FILL

B1BSYmjLE.description: Update. Trigger write to display buffer.
B1BSYmjLE.label: UPD

rkgRBHhIV.label: COLOUR

@/draw-circle.description: Draw a circle. Writes data to display buffer. To show content of display buffer on screen use node send-buffer-to-display.

Sk3yt7sIE.label: COLOUR

rkCbYXoU4.description: Update. Trigger write to display buffer.
rkCbYXoU4.label: UPD

BJ7fUQiL4.label: COLOUR

Bkr-NC9IN.description: Update. Trigger write to display buffer.
Bkr-NC9IN.label: UPD

@/draw-line.description: Draw a line. Data written to display buffer. To show content of display buffer on screen use node send-buffer-to-display.

@/03-example-rotate-display.description: Text will be drawn in two different directions.

@/05-example-grid.description: A grid will be drawn on the display.

@/01-draw-text.description: Four lines of text will be drawn.

B11QT1qLN.description: Update. Trigger write to display buffer.
B11QT1qLN.label: UPD

BkhUQ_2IN.label: COLOUR

S1gH6CKIN.description: Text string. Special characters can be specified using octal index. For example the degree symbol "" (decimal code 248) can be specified using "\370".
S1gH6CKIN.label: TEXT

@/draw-text.description: Writes string to display buffer. To show content of display buffer on screen use node send-buffer-to-display.

Bk2kHunU4.description: TRUE to fill triangle with colour, FALSE to draw outline only.
Bk2kHunU4.label: FILL

HJL2JSOh8V.description: Update. Trigger write to display buffer.
HJL2JSOh8V.label: UPD

S1DhJBO38V.label: COLOUR

@/draw-triangle.description: Draw a triangle. Writes data to display buffer. To show content of display buffer on screen use node send-buffer-to-display.

@/get-display-dimensions.description: Get dimensions of display in pixels.

Sk5RTCF84.description: If true, switch to invert mode (black-on-white), else normal mode (white-on-black).
Sk5RTCF84.label: INV

@/invert-display.description:
Enable or disable display invert mode (white-on-black vs black-on-white).  This has an immediate effect on the display, no need to use the send-buffer-to-display node  -- buffer contents are not changed, rather a different pixel mode of the display hardware is used. When 
 enabled, drawing BLACK (value 0) pixels will actually draw white,  WHITE (value 1) will draw black.

@/02-example-draw-shapes.description: Draw shapes in proportion to display size.

@/clear-display.description: Clear contents of display buffer (set all pixels to off). Changes buffer contents only, no immediate effect on display. Follow up with a call to send-buffer-to-display, or with other graphics commands as needed by one's own application.

r1IFsRIn8E.description: Update. Trigger write to display buffer.
r1IFsRIn8E.label: UPD

r1KoAU3LN.description: TRUE to fill rectangle with colour, FALSE to draw outline only.
r1KoAU3LN.label: FILL

rkvYiAInI4.label: COLOUR

@/draw-rectangle.description: Draw a rectangle. Writes data to display buffer. To show content of display buffer on screen use node send-buffer-to-display.

HyIYbhwh8E.description: Update. Trigger write to display buffer.
HyIYbhwh8E.label: UPD

r1tZnDhLV.description: TRUE to fill rectangle with colour, FALSE to draw outline only.
r1tZnDhLV.label: FILL

ryPtZnPhIN.label: COLOUR

@/draw-rounded-rectangle.description: Draw a rounded  rectangle. Writes data to display buffer. To show content of display buffer on screen use node send-buffer-to-display.

BJ7urnUq8.description: 00h through to 03h corresponding to 4 cardinal rotations.
BJ7urnUq8.label: ROT

ByZE0V3L9I.description: Rotates display in any of the four cardinal directions.

@/send-buffer-to-display.description: Push data currently in RAM to display. Drawing operations are not visible until this function is called. Call after each graphics command, or after a whole set of graphics commands, as best needed by one's own application.

HyWOqSYLE.description: Reset pin (using Arduino pin numbering), or -1 if not used  (some displays might be wired to share the microcontroller's reset pin).
HyWOqSYLE.label: RESET_PIN

description: Arduino library for OLED displays driven by the SH1107 chip. Communication via I2C. Wraps Adafruit_SH130x (https://github.com/adafruit/Adafruit_SH110x). Tested using a Pimoroni Mono OLED Breakout (1.12" 128x128 pixels) and ESP32.
name: sh1107-oled-i2c
